extendedIngredients.name: boursin herb cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 85g garlic and herb cheese such as Boursin or roulé

extendedIngredients.name: cheddar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 85g mature cheddar, or other hard cheese

extendedIngredients.name: fresh parsley
extendedIngredients.originalString: a handful of parsley, roughly chopped

extendedIngredients.name: nutmeg
extendedIngredients.originalString: half a nutmeg (or ¼ tsp ready ground)

extendedIngredients.name: nuts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 85g mixed nuts, such as cashews, blanched almonds, and hazelnuts, roughly chopped
metaInformation: such as cashews, blanched almonds, and hazelnuts, roughly chopped

recipes.title: Cheeseboard pasta bake

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

recipes.instructions: To cook the pasta, bring a large pan of water to the boil, add a generous measure of salt and tip in the pasta. Stir once and return to the boil, then boil rapidly for 12 minutes. Preheat the oven to 190C/gas 5/fan 170C.To make the sauce, pour the milk into a pan and add the butter, flour and plenty of seasoning. Grate in the half nutmeg (or sprinkle in the ready ground). Bring to the boil over a medium heat, whisking all the time until it makes a smooth, creamy sauce.Drain the pasta and tip it into the sauce. Taste and add extra seasoning if necessary. Stir in the ham and grate in the cheddar, then tip into a shallow ovenproof dish. Dice the remaining cheeses and swirl into the pasta to make cheesy pockets.Mix the nuts and parsley together, then scatter over the pasta. Bake in the oven for 30 minutes until the nuts are golden and crunchy and everything is piping hot.

steps.step: To cook the pasta, bring a large pan of water to the boil, add a generous measure of salt and tip in the pasta. Stir once and return to the boil, then boil rapidly for 12 minutes. Preheat the oven to 190C/gas 5/fan 170C.To make the sauce, pour the milk into a pan and add the butter, flour and plenty of seasoning. Grate in the half nutmeg (or sprinkle in the ready ground). Bring to the boil over a medium heat, whisking all the time until it makes a smooth, creamy sauce.

Drain the pasta and tip it into the sauce. Taste and add extra seasoning if necessary. Stir in the ham and grate in the cheddar, then tip into a shallow ovenproof dish. Dice the remaining cheeses and swirl into the pasta to make cheesy pockets.
Mix the nuts and parsley together, then scatter over the pasta.
Bake in the oven for 30 minutes until the nuts are golden and crunchy and everything is piping hot.
